attributes.action: Petition for a day of mourning to those who have died from the covid pandemic
attributes.additional_details: It seems the government have failed in their efforts to control the spread of covid, resulting in more than 100,000 deaths. In Boris’ recent address, he failed in my opinion to mention anything to remember the memory of those who have died, rather instead telling the public to follow the rules. Given the seriousness of covid, I felt what Boris’ suggested was very insensitive and it didn’t seem sincere. I feel a day of mourning is the least the government can do to honour those who have died.
attributes.background: I want the government to set up a day and time so we can remember the memory of those who have died as a result of the pandemic

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

A national holiday and day of remembrance for those lost in the COVID pandemic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/568631

An annual day of remembrance and memorial for the victims of the COVID-19 virus: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561869

Make March 23rd an annual National COVID Memorial day from 2022: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572335
